title: UNPCKHPS â€” Unpack and Interleave High Packed Single-Precision Floating-Point Values

fields.name: Instruction Modes
fields.value:
`UNPCKHPS xmm1, xmm2/m128`
`VUNPCKHPS xmm1, xmm2, xmm3/m128`
`VUNPCKHPS ymm1, ymm2, ymm3/m256`
`VUNPCKHPS xmm1 {k1}{z}, xmm2, xmm3/m128/m32bcst`
`VUNPCKHPS ymm1 {k1}{z}, ymm2, ymm3/m256/m32bcst`
`VUNPCKHPS zmm1 {k1}{z}, zmm2, zmm3/m512/m32bcst`

fields.name: Description
fields.value: Performs an interleaved unpack of the high single-precision floating-point values from the first source operand and the second source operand.

fields.name: ​
fields.value: 128-bit Legacy SSE version: The second source can be an XMM register or an 128-bit memory location. The destination is not distinct from the first source XMM register and the upper bits (MAXVL-1:128) of the corresponding ZMM register destination are unmodified. When unpacking from a memory operand, an implementation may fetch only the appropriate 64 bits; however, alignment to 16-byte boundary and normal segment checking will still be enforced.

fields.name: ​
fields.value: VEX.128 encoded version: The first source operand is a XMM register. The second source operand can be a XMM register or a 128-bit memory location. The destination operand is a XMM register. The upper bits (MAXVL-1:128) of the corresponding ZMM register destination are zeroed.

fields.name: ​
fields.value: VEX.256 encoded version: The second source operand is an YMM register or an 256-bit memory location. The first source operand and destination operands are YMM registers.

footer.text: Thanks to Felix Cloutier for the online x86 reference
